oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Path Killer correspondence with Cyrus Kingsbury, 1817 April 28
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Pathkiller, Cherokee Chief
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from Cherokee Chief Pathkiller to Brainerd Mission founder Cyrus Kingsbury requesting that Kingsbury supply 18 families with 6 bushels of corn at a price of $1.50 per bushel, cost to be incurred by the United States Indian Affairs Agency and to be charged to the Cherokee annuity.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Cherokee Indians -- History; Cherokee Indians -- Missions
Kingsbury, Cyrus, 1786-1870; Pathkiller, Cherokee Chief
Brainerd Mission
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Penelope Johnson Allen Brainerd Mission correspondence and photographs
